snippet: Acting as shadow campaigns, the political committees backing the major presidential candidates supported them with tens of millions of dollars in chartered planes, luxury hotel suites, opposition research, high-priced lawyers and more, spending...
abstract: Campaign disclosures filed with Federal Election Commission reveal extraordinary amount of money being spent on 2016 presidential candidates by super PACs as well as multi-million-dollar contributions to PACs by wealthy individuals; watchdog groups maintain candidates are illegally circumventing fund-raising regulations.
lead_paragraph: Acting as shadow campaigns, the political committees backing the major presidential candidates supported them with tens of millions of dollars in chartered planes, luxury hotel suites, opposition research, high-priced lawyers and more, spending reports showed Friday.

headline.main: ‘Super PACs’ Spent Millions Before Candidates Announced, Filings Show
headline.print_headline: ‘Super PACs’ Spent Millions Before Candidates Announced, Filings Show

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Right to Rise Policy Solutions Inc
